column4: Question: When I boot up ubuntu on this laptop, it says loading kernel, starting up, and then, when the graphical boot loader bar should come in, it goes black. It boots up fine, but this emptiness is creepy. Can I get the graphical boot loader to work?
Graphical boot loader? you mean X?
I mean that horizontal, orange rectangle that gets bigger and bigger
a loading bar?
Yes, I said that.
Apparently another guy with a laptop has the same problem. He asked here as well.
it's probly outputting a graphical format your monitor can't display
It shouldn't be, it worked fine in ubuntu 6.10
And from what I see on my desktop PC, where it does work, it hasn't changed much or at all.
It's not really a PROBLEM, it just sucks more than a black hole.
I wouldn't worry about it that much... it isn't a crucial feature
you can always hit alt+f1-f4 to check what's happening if it hangs too long
Is it possible to make it use a text boot by default, but still load GDM?
I am pretty sure you can edit grub to make it do that
sure, use the nosplash option
I believe the recovery entry has the nosplash option, just copy the syntax from there
Ah, great, thanks!
np.. just checked my menu.lst, you simply remove the 'spash'
I noticed too. Thanks though :)
What happens if I remove "quiet"?
I'm not sure, I assume it would either use the pcspkr module to output sound... or would output more activity logs for debugging purposes
Thanks :)
